tags.name: SSO
tags.description: On Prisma Cloud, you can enable single sign-on (SSO) using an Identity Provider (IdP) that supports Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) or OpenID Connect (OIDC), such as Okta, Microsoft Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS), Azure Active Directory (AD), Google, or OneLogin. Prisma Cloud System Administrators can use the following APIs to configure tenant SSO.

tags.name: Permission Groups
tags.description: Permission groups enable you to restrict access to one or more features available on the Prisma Cloud administrative console. Permission group APIs allow you to retrieve, update or delete one or more existing permissions groups. You can also use these APIs to create a custom permission group and then you must attach it to a role and assign the role to a user.

get.description: Queries existing Permission Groups by ID and returns a specific permission group that matches the Permission Group ID

parameters.name: includeAssociatedRoles
parameters.description: To include associated roles in the response

put.description: Updates the parameters of an existing Permission Group.

delete.summary: Delete a Permission Group by ID
delete.description: Deletes an existing permission group based on the permissionGroupId

get.description: Used by System Admins to get the SAML Configuration for the tenancy

put.description: Used by System Admins to update the SAML Configuration for the tenancy

post.description: Used by System Admins to create the SAML Configuration for the tenancy

get.description: Get the OAuth2 configuration details of a tenant that is used by OpenID Connect(OIDC).

put.description: Updates all the parameters of an existing OAuth2 configuration that is used by OpenID Connect(OIDC).

post.description: Create an OAuth2 configuration for a given tenant to be used by OpenID Connect(OIDC).

patch.description: Updates only the specified parameters of an existing OAuth2 configuration that is used by OpenID Connect(OIDC).

get.description: Returns the list of all existing Default and Custom Permission Groups.

parameters.name: includeAssociatedRoles
parameters.description: To include associated roles in the response

parameters.name: includeFeatures
parameters.description: To include permitted features in the response

post.description: Creates a new custom permission group with granular permissions that restrict access to the Prisma Cloud administrative console. Values include name, optional description and selection of enabled features and functions.

get.description: Returns the list of Prisma Cloud features that can be added to Custom Permission Groups
Get the OIDC login URL for the tenant.

parameters.name: user_name
parameters.description: User name requesting the login URL.

parameters.name: prisma_id
parameters.description: Prisma ID for the tenant of the user requesting the login.

featureName.description: Prisma Cloud Feature Name. Prisma Cloud feature names can be retreived from GET: /authz/v1/feature API Endpoint

additionalProperties.description: A mapping of operations and a boolean value representing whether the privilege to perform the operation needs to be granted.

operations.description: A mapping of operations and a boolean value representing whether the privilege to perform the operation needs to be granted.

audienceUri.description: Audience URI or Prisma Cloud SP-Entity-Id

requireAccessSamlUrlPublic.description: Skip Public address check for Access SAML URL

autoProvisionSamlFirstName.description: JIT provisioning SAML Attribute - First name

autoProvisionSamlLastName.description: JIT provisioning SAML Attribute - Last name

redLockAccessSamlUrl.description: Identity Provider Configured Prisma Cloud Access URL

AllowListParams.title: IpAllowListParams
AllowListParams.description: Model for login IP allow list parameters

cidr.description: List of CIDR blocks (IP addresses) from which access is allowed when Login IP Allow List flag is enabled.

items.description: List of CIDR blocks (IP addresses) from which access is allowed when Login IP Allow List flag is enabled.

lastModifiedTs.description: Timestamp for last modification of CIDR block list

IpAllowListData.description: Model for login IP allow list data

clientId.description: Client ID obtained after Identity Provider(IdP) configuration.

issuer.description: The identifier of the OpenID Connect(OIDC) provider.

scopes.description: Identifiers used to specify what access privileges are being requested.

items.description: Identifiers used to specify what access privileges are being requested.

grantType.description: Grant types are a way to specify how a client wants to interact with an Identity Provider(IdP).

withPkce.description: Using proof key for code exchange(PKCE) as additional verification.  PKCE ensures that only the client that requests the access token can redeem it.

idpAuthUri.description: The URL of the authentication endpoint on the Identity Provider(IdP).

tokenUri.description: The Identity Provider token endpoint URL for obtaining access and ID tokens.

jwkSetUri.description: The URL of the Identity Provider(IdP) JSON Web Key Set document.This document contains signing keys that are used to validate the signatures from the provider.

endSessionUri.description: The URL used to sign out the user from the Identity Provider(IdP).

isActive.description: True to enable SSO using OIDC; False otherwise.

jitRoleClaimName.description: Token claim providing the name of Prisma Cloud role for user.

jitDefaultRoleId.description: Default Prisma Cloud role to use for JIT when claim is missing or undefined.

pcAuthUri.description: Prisma Cloud endpoint URL to begin the authentication flow.

pcRelayUri.description: Prisma Cloud callback endpoint URL from the IdP during authentication.

lastModifiedBy.description: User who made the last update.

clientSecretIsBlank.description: True if client secret is not configured; False otherwise.

ExternalJwtIntegration.title: Model used for JWT integrations with external vendors
ExternalJwtIntegration.description: Model used for JWT integrations with external vendors

accessKeyExpiration.description: Access key expiration timestamp in milliseconds

enableKeyExpiration.description: true = Enable access key expiration. Default is false.

authorized.description: Null if roles query param is not sent otherwise {true only if the roles are authorized for the token}

customer_name.description: Should only be specified for compute console

prisma_id.description: Should only be specified for compute console

expiresOn.description: Timestamp in milliseconds when access key expires

accessKeyExpiration.description: Access key expiration timestamp in milliseconds

enableKeyExpiration.description: true = Enable access key expiration. Default is false.

custom.description: Indicates whether the permissionGroup associated with the role is 'Default' or 'Custom' type.

features.description:
Collection of permitted features associated with the role. 
 Refer to PermissionGroup API docs to get the entire list of PC features.

RoleInternalPermissionGroup.description: Permission Group is only populated for the active role, i.e. active=true

active.description: Indicates whether the role is active role or not

default.description: Indicates whether the role is default or not

additionalProperties.description: Map of associated role Ids and Names

associatedRoles.description: Map of associated role Ids and Names

custom.description: Boolean value signifying whether this is a custom (i.e. user-defined) permission group. Is set to true if the attribute value of permissionGroupType is set to CUSTOM
Boolean value signifying whether this is a custom (i.e. user-defined) permission group. Is set to true if the attribute value of permissionGroupType is set to CUSTOM

expiresOn.description: Timestamp in milliseconds when access key expires

x-redlock-auth.description: The x-redlock-auth value is a JSON Web Token (JWT).
